cartodup package¶

Submodules¶

cartodup.comparator module¶

class cartodup.comparator.Comparator(shingles_size=3)¶

Bases: object

add(url: cartodup.extractor.URL)¶

Adds an URL to the matrix after having computed a duplication ratio for each other URL.

Parameters:url – The new URL that will be added.
display()¶
print_csv(out)¶

Prints the duplication matrix as CSV to the given out file. This file should either be sys.stdout or a CSV file.

Parameters:out – The file-like object to print to.

cartodup.extractor module¶

class cartodup.extractor.URL(url: str)¶

Bases: object

get_resource() → str¶
Returns:
static get_resource_static(url: str) → str¶

Removes the protocol and replaces all special chars in the given URL by a dash, providing a better filename to save on disk.

Parameters:url – The URL string to treat.
Returns:A path to an HTML resource obtained from the given URL.
strip_protocol() → str¶

See strip_protocol_static.

static strip_protocol_static(url: str) → str¶

Removes the protocol from an URL string e.g. removing http/https/....

Parameters:url – The URL string to treat.
Returns:The URL string without the protocol.
Return type:str
cartodup.extractor.extract(url: str) → cartodup.extractor.URL¶

Fetches an URL string, saves HTML data to a disk file and returns the given URL as an URL object.

Parameters:url – The URL to fetch from.
Returns:The URL object built with the given string.

cartodup.jaccard module¶

cartodup.jaccard.get_shingles(f, shingles_size, max_shingles=-1)¶
Parameters:
  • f – The file to read.
  • shingles_size – The size of shingles.
  • max_shingles – If filled, this option triggers probabilistic method

with a maximum of max_shingles shingles. :return: An iterator of shingles. :rtype: Iterator

cartodup.jaccard.jaccard(file1, file2, shingles_size=3) → float¶

Computes the jaccard distance between to sets.

Parameters:
  • file1 – The first file to compare.
  • file2 – The second file to compare.
  • shingles_size – The size of shingles.
Returns:

The result of comparison.
Return type:

float

cartodup.parser module¶

cartodup.parser.parse(path: str) → str¶

Extracts URLs from given file’s path.

Parameters:path – A path to the file containing different URLs to fetch.
Returns:A generator containing lines read from the file.
Return type:str
